abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Telecommunications Project in
            Hungary. The two loans and projects for telecommunications
            in Hungary were made with the continued development
            objectives, adapted to the operational and institutional
            content evolving with time, of (i) assisting the
            country's main telecommunications (TC) operating entity
            in modernizing and expanding the systems under two
            successive enlarged development programs, and (ii)
            simultaneously ensuring the transition, in feasible steps,
            from government type operation of a monopolistic utility
            toward autonomous and efficient commercial type operation of
            the services, with separate authorities for the service
            provision and regulatory functions. Overall Bank performance
            has been satisfactory under the project. The Borrower's
            performance has been highly satisfactory. The key lessons
            learned are as follows: (a) the decade-long participation of
            the Bank in the Hungarian Telecommunications sector had a
            major and profound impact on its development, organization
            and institutional evolution; (b) the first and second
            telecommunications projects, which had about three common
            years of implementation, can be considered as continuous
            operations with complementary and interrelated objectives
            and results; (c) the timing of the second project made it
            possible to take best advantage of the new digital
            technology in the planning, construction and operation of
            modernized and expanded networks, digitalization strategy
            prepared under the first project being applied in the design
            of the second project and some procurement items being
            redistributed to best benefit from the falling costs of
            equipment; (d) to utilize alternative financing esources
            rather than the Bank loan resulted in a partial disbursement
            of Loan; (e) the continuity in the staff involved in the
            dialogue with the Hungarian authorities and the two-pronged
            support from the Bank and IFC in strengthening Matav's
            capabilities and the opening up of part of the TC sector to
            liberalized activities and competition, facilitated the
            progress of the ongoing sector reform; (f) the
            determination, persistence and consistency of Government of
            Hungary(GOH) resulted in major steps being taken towards the
            deregulation of the sector, the establishment of private or
            privatized players in the TC market and the gradual
            liberalization of the sector in line with current worldwide
            trends; and (g) how the strengthening and development of the
            main TC operator through traditional investment lending to a
            government-owned public utility can be instrumental to the
            actual privatization of the sector when there is the
            political will and the Government is determined to
            effectively engage and implement an in-depth reform of the
            whole sector.
